hanzi-su-wiki:
業

Значения

Дело, работа, искусство, ловкость; занятие, профессия

Мнемоника

  • Ветки дерева 未, собранные в веник. Вязать веники, работа, промысел.

  • "Я держу овец 羊 за забором. Это моя работа, промысел."

Варианты

业

heisig_chinese_memo: A truly gruesome profession: an abattoir worker. Where the carcasses are upside down side by side in a row that have not yet been cut up into sausages and steaks.
heisig_constituent: business, profession, upside down in a row, not yet, tree, wood
heisig_story: In a row upside down . . . not yet.
koohiiStory1: The oldest profession: prostitution. I was once in a brothel in Amsterdam where the working girls had a group of businessmen blindfolded and hanging upside down in a row, not yet spanked and whipped, but waiting eagerly.
koohiiStory2: A bunch of kids are hanging upside down in a row on the monkeybars. Naturally, they haven't chosen a profession, at least not yet.

jp_readingExamples: 業績 (ぎょうせき), 職業 (しょくぎょう), 卒業 (そつぎょう), 業 (わざ)
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: If a sheep is having trouble trying to eat a fish with spikes on its fins, then the sheep probably has no business trying to eat it in the first place. Don’t sheep usually eat like, grass and stuff? What is this sheep doing trying to eat a fish with spikes on its fins? What silly business this is.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine this crazy sheep. Why is it trying to eat this fish? This sheep is blood crazed. Blood crazed for fish meat, especially the meat from fish with spikes on their fins. This crazed sheep means business.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: What’s this? The sheep is also trying to eat some gyoza (ぎょう) dumplings! Where will this sheep’s madness end? First spikey finned fish and now gyoza? This is some crazy business.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Imagine you’re at an Asian style restaurant and you just ordered a big plate of gyoza dumplings. Next thing you know, this crazy sheep busts through the front door and starts devouring all your gyoza! Where did this sheep come from and why does he love gyoza so much!?
Ru_Radicals: 一 (один), ｜, 并, 木 (дерево), 王 (монарх), 羊 (овца), 耒 (лопата)

chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: In a profession you are standing side by side with others who do similar stuff but there is no limit to what you can do, hence the lack of the top part of 'side by side'.
humanum_full_description_en:
" Karma " is like two bronze figures standing side by side holding up bamboo shoots (horizontal wood of hanging bells and chimes), so " Karma " is the pictogram of the frame on which bell chimes are hung.

Inscriptions from the second " business " from the " go " and "Wen said," nearly classical form, " to the ancient text," There are two sources of " business " from the word of " go " is " He beginning of the text," reads It is made as "盍", which has the same shape as the ware and cover (see Qiu Xigui), which is the sound symbol of " karma ". In the later period, the inscriptions only used a " karma " from the " mouth ", and the lower part of the " karma " shared the strokes of the word " to ".

"poetry. Zhou Song. "You 瞽": "Set up a business and set up a ya, and a tree and feather." Ya is the ancient pillars on both sides of the shelf where the bell was hung. "Book of Rites. "Tan Gong Shang": "There is a bell but no scorpion." Zheng Xuan's note: "Heng said 簨, planting is called 虡." (refer to Chinese Dictionary)

" Ju is the" " Ju " the folk characters, and "Ju industry" term refers to the suspension Zhong Qing shelf.

Inscriptions have used inheritance or exploits of the industry, such as Zhongshan Wang Inscription ︰ "within absolutely Shao public of the industry." From the " go to " "the industry " word pass off as " the Association " represents a secondary phase, Sasuke, Qin Duke Gui: "Paul "Ye (䢃) 氒"also—have" Qin" means blessing and assisting Qin. It also means stability, 𤼈Zhong: "Industrial integrity (sui) is rich and blessed", which means stability and happiness.

See " Ya ".
humanum_short_description_en: " Karma " is like two bronze figures standing side by side holding up bamboo shoots (horizontal wood of hanging bells and chimes), so " karma " is a pictogram of a frame hanging bells and chimes.
humanum_full_description:
「業」象兩個並立的銅人舉筍(懸鐘磬之橫木)之形，故「業」是懸掛鐘磬的架子的象形。

　　金文從二「業」從「去」，與《說文》古文形近，「去」的古文字有兩個來源，「業」字所從的「去」是「盍」的初文，讀作「盍」，象器蓋相合之形(參裘錫圭)，是「業」的聲符。後期金文只從一個「業」從「口」，「業」的下部和「去」字共用筆畫。

　　《詩．周頌．有瞽》︰「設業設虡，崇牙樹羽。」虡即古時懸掛鐘磬的架子兩旁的柱子。《禮記．檀弓上》︰「有鐘磬而無簨虡。」鄭玄注︰「橫曰簨，植曰虡。」（參漢語大字典）

　　「簴」乃「虡」的俗字，而「虡業」一詞泛指懸掛鐘磬的架子。

　　金文中有用作基業或功業之業，如中山王器銘︰「以內絕邵公之業。」從「去」的「業」字通假為「協」，表示輔相、佐助，秦公簋：「保業(䢃)氒〈又─有〉秦」，表示保佑輔助秦國。又表示安定之意，𤼈鐘：「業妥(綏)厚多福」，表示安定而多福之意。

　　參見「虡」。
humanum_short_description: 「業」象兩個並立的銅人舉筍(懸鐘磬之橫木)之形，故「業」是懸掛鐘磬的架子的象形。

①國民經濟中的部門：工業。農業。
②職務，工作崗位：職業。就業。
③學習的功課：學業。肄業。畢業。業精於勤。
④重大的成就或功勞：創業。豐功偉業。業績。
⑤從事：業醫。業商。
⑥財產：產業。
⑦既，已經：業已。業經。
⑧佛教名詞：業報(佛教指善行、惡行的報應)。業障(亦稱“孽障”)。
⑨姓氏。

「 業 」象兩個並立的銅人舉筍(懸鐘磬之橫木)之形，故「 業 」是懸掛鐘磬的架子的象形。 金文從二「 業 」從「 去 」，與《說文》古文形近，「 去 」的古文字有兩個來源，「 業 」字所從的「 去 」是「 盍 」的初文，讀作「 盍 」，象器蓋相合之形(參裘錫圭)，是「 業 」的聲符。後期金文只從一個「 業 」從「 口 」，「 業 」的下部和「 去 」字共用筆畫。 《詩．周頌．有瞽》︰「設業設虡，崇牙樹羽。」虡即古時懸掛鐘磬的架子兩旁的柱子。《禮記．檀弓上》︰「有鐘磬而無簨虡。」鄭玄注︰「橫曰簨，植曰虡。」（參漢語大字典） 「 簴 」乃「 虡 」的俗字，而「虡業」一詞泛指懸掛鐘磬的架子。 金文中有用作基業或功業之業，如中山王器銘︰「以內絕邵公之業。」從「 去 」的「 業 」字通假為「 協 」，表示輔相、佐助，秦公簋：「保業(䢃)氒〈又─有〉秦」，表示保佑輔助秦國。又表示安定之意，𤼈鐘：「業妥(綏)厚多福」，表示安定而多福之意。 參見「 虡 」。
" Karma" is like two bronze figures standing side by side holding up bamboo shoots (horizontal wood of hanging bells and chimes), so " Karma" is the pictogram of the frame on which bell chimes are hung. Inscriptions from the second " business" from the " go" and "Wen said," nearly classical form, " to the ancient text," There are two sources of " business" from the word of " go" is " He beginning of the text," reads It is made as " 盍", which has the same shape as the ware and cover (see Qiu Xigui), which is the sound symbol of " karma". In the later period, the inscriptions only used a " karma" from the " mouth", and the lower part of the " karma" shared the strokes of the word " to". "poetry. Zhou Song. "You 瞽": "Set up a business and set up a ya, and a tree and feather." Ya is the ancient pillars on both sides of the shelf where the bell was hung. "Book of Rites. "Tan Gong Shang": "There is a bell but no scorpion." Zheng Xuan's note: "Heng said 簨, planting is called 虡." (refer to Chinese Dictionary) " Ju is the" " Ju" the folk characters, and "Ju industry" term refers to the suspension Zhong Qing shelf. Inscriptions have used inheritance or exploits of the industry, such as Zhongshan Wang Inscription ︰ "within absolutely Shao public of the industry." From the " go to" "the industry" word pass off as " the Association" represents a secondary phase, Sasuke, Qin Duke Gui: "Paul "Ye (䢃) 氒"also—have" Qin" means blessing and assisting Qin. It also means stability, 𤼈Zhong: "Industrial integrity (sui) is rich and blessed", which means stability and happiness. See " Ya".

業字的基本解释

業
yè
见“业”。

業字的汉语字典释义

[①]［yè］
［《廣韻》魚怯切，入業，疑。］
“业1”的繁体字。
(1)版，大版。古代覆在悬挂钟、鼓等乐器架横木上的装饰物，刻如锯齿形，涂以白色。
(2)版，大版。筑墙版。
(3)版，大版。古代书册之版。
(4)版，大版。亦指写字用的业版。
(5)学业。
(6)基业，功业。
(7)家业，产业。
(8)事务；职业。
(9)成业；使之立业或乐业。
(10)以……为业；从事于。
(11)创始、开始。
(12)继，继承。
(13)依次；次序。
(14)既，已经。
(15)佛教语。梵文karman羯磨的意译。佛教谓业由身、口、意三处发动，分别称身业、口业、意业。业分善、不善、非善非不善三种，一般偏指恶业，孽。它决定在六道中的生死轮回。
(16)通“陧”。危，不安。
(17)见“業業”。
(18)见“業業”、“業峨”。

業字的康熙字典解释

【辰集中】【木字部】　業； 康熙笔画：13； 页码：页541第05
〔古文〕??【唐韻】魚怯切【集韻】逆怯切，?音鄴。【說文】業，大板也，所以飾懸鐘鼓。【詩·大雅】虡業維樅。【疏】植鐘磐之木，植者名爲虡，橫牽者爲栒，栒上加大版爲之飾爲業。刻板捷業如鋸齒，故曰業。　又功業。【易·繫辭】富有之謂大業。　又事業。【易·坤卦】暢於四支，發於事業。　又基業。【孟子】創業垂統。　又學業。【禮·曲禮】所習必有業。　又世業。【左傳·昭元年】子產曰：臺駘能業其官。　又【爾雅·釋訓】業業，危也。【書·臯陶謨】兢兢業業，一日二日萬幾。　又壯也。【詩·小雅】四牡業業，又凡所攻治者曰業，事物已爲而未成亦曰業。【孟子】有業履於牖上。　又已然曰業。【前漢·吳王濞傳】高祖召濞相之，悔業已拜。　又藝業。【史記·貨殖傳】田農，拙業也，賣漿，小業也。　又建業，地名。【吳志】權改秣陵爲建業。　又姓。【姓苑】有業氏。　又【集韻】逆及切，音岌。亦壯也。　又【集韻】玉盍切。亦危也。　又叶宜戟切，音逆。【鶡冠子·泰鴻篇】兩治四致，閒以止息。歸時離氣，以成萬業。

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［yè］
["Guangyun" fish is timid, enters the industry, suspicious. ]
Traditional characters for "业1".
(1) Version, large version. In ancient times, the decorations covered on the horizontal wood of hanging bells, drums and other musical instruments are carved in a zigzag shape and painted in white.
(2) Version, large version. Build a wall version.
(3) Version, large version. Edition of ancient books.
(4) Version, large version. Also refers to the business version for writing.
(5) Studies.
(6) Foundation, achievement.
(7) Family business, industry.
(8) Affairs; occupation.
(9) Become a business; make it a business or a happy business.
(10) To take ... as an occupation; to be engaged in.
(11) Founding and beginning.
(12) Following, inheritance.
(13) Sequence; sequence.
(14) Now, already.
(15) Buddhist language. A free translation of the Sanskrit karman karma. Buddhism says that karma is initiated by body, mouth, and mind, which are called body karma, mouth karma, and mind karma respectively. Karma is divided into three types: good, bad, non-good and non-bad, and generally refers to bad karma and evil. It determines the cycle of life and death in the six realms.
(16) Through "Zhou". Dangerous, uneasy.
(17) See "Karma".
(18) See "YeYe" and "YeYe".

Name meaning
Same as "industry".
yè
вм. 业

業

Значения

Дело, работа, искусство, ловкость; занятие, профессия

Мнемоника

  • Ветки дерева 未, собранные в веник. Вязать веники, работа, промысел.

  • "Я держу овец 羊 за забором. Это моя работа, промысел."

Варианты

业

Radicals: 羊, ハ  (sheep, fins, spikes)
Meaning Mnemonic
If a sheep is having trouble trying to eat a fish with spikes on its fins, then the sheep probably has no business trying to eat it in the first place. Don’t sheep usually eat like, grass and stuff? What is this sheep doing trying to eat a fish with spikes on its fins? What silly business this is.
Imagine this crazy sheep. Why is it trying to eat this fish? This sheep is blood crazed. Blood crazed for fish meat, especially the meat from fish with spikes on their fins. This crazed sheep means business.
Reading Mnemonic
What’s this? The sheep is also trying to eat some gyoza (ぎょう) dumplings! Where will this sheep’s madness end? First spikey finned fish and now gyoza? This is some crazy business.
Imagine you’re at an Asian style restaurant and you just ordered a big plate of gyoza dumplings. Next thing you know, this crazy sheep busts through the front door and starts devouring all your gyoza! Where did this sheep come from and why does he love gyoza so much!?
